Budak nyaris dihanyut banjir
03 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Ramli Ibrahim



NORIZAN sempat selamatkan anak perempuannya. FOTO ihsan pembaca



PENDUDUK membersihkan lumpur di kawasan rumah mereka di Kampung Tanah Puteh selepas banjir kilat mulai surut. FOTO ihsan pembaca


SEORANG kanak-kanak perempuan berusia dua tahun nyaris dihanyut arus deras apabila rumahnya di Kampung Tanah Puteh, di sini, dilanda banjir kilat, kelmarin.
Dalam kejadian jam 10 malam, kanak-kanak terbabit sempat diselamatkan ibunya, Norizan Awang, 48, yang mengharungi banjir setinggi 0.5 meter.
Kanak-kanak berkenaan antara mangsa daripada 12 keluarga yang terjejas akibat banjir kilat susulan hujan lebat lebih tiga jam melanda daerah ini.
Difahamkan penempatan itu mula dinaiki air pada jam 8 malam dan surut semula pada jam 2 pagi.
Menceritakan kejadian cemas itu Norizan berkata, kediamannya mula dinaiki air jam 10 malam dan ketika itu dia memindahkan dokumen penting ke tempat selamat.
Katanya, dalam sekelip mata air naik ke paras 0.5 meter dan ketika itu anaknya diletakkan di atas katil di dalam bilik.
“Berikutan itu, saya bergegas menyelamatkan anak perempuan dan ketika itu lima lagi anak yang lain keluar ke tempat selamat.
“Termasuk kejadian ini sudah lima kali rumah kami dilanda banjir kilat sepanjang tahun ini dan mungkin bencana sama berulang lagi sebelum berakhir musim tengkujuh,” katanya.
Sementara itu, Pegawai Angkatan Pertahanan Awam Malaysia (APM) daerah Gua Muasang, Mohd Yusalmi Yusoff berkata, banjir kilat menjejaskan 30 kediaman di tiga penempatan.
Katanya, selain Kampung Tanah Puteh, banjir kilat turut dilaporkan di Kampung Lepan Jaya dan Perumahan Agropolitan Rantau Manis.
Yusalmi berkata, APM mengerahkan seramai 10 anggota ke lokasi bagi membantu memindahkan mangsa terjejas.

The boy was almost swept away by the flood
03 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Ramli Ibrahim



NORIZAN was able to save his daughter. PHOTOS courtesy of readers



Residents are cleaning mud in their home area of Kampung Tanah Puteh after flash floods began to recede. PHOTOS courtesy of readers


A two-year-old girl was nearly swept away when her home in Kampung Tanah Puteh, here, was hit by a flash flood yesterday.
In the 10-hour incident, the children were rescued by their mother, Norizan Awang, 48, who suffered a flood of 0.5 meters.
Children were among the victims of 12 families affected by lightning floods following heavy rains over three hours.
It is understood that the settlement started flooding at 8pm and receding at 2am.
Describing the incident, Norizan said her home started flooding at 10pm and at that time she was moving important documents to a safe place.
She said that in a flash the spring rose to a height of 0.5 meters and at that moment her son was placed in a bed in the room.
“As a result, I rushed to the rescue of the girls and at the same time five other children went to safety.
"Including this incident has been five times that our house has been hit by lightning floods throughout the year and may have repeated the same disaster before the end of the monsoon season," he said.
Meanwhile, Gua Muasang district Public Defense Force (APM) officer Mohd Yusalmi Yusoff said the flash flood affected 30 homes in three settlements.
He said apart from Kampung Taneh Puteh, flash floods were also reported in Kampung Lepan Jaya and Agropolitan Housing in the Sweet Region.
Yusalmi said APM deployed 10 members to the site to help evacuate victims.
